subject: Sleep
title: Ant Colony Sleep Shifts
description: A quick, practical guide to Ant Colony Sleep Shifts.

hook.text: Fire ant queens sleep nine hours a day. Workers sleep less than five, in 250 one-minute naps. Life isn't fair, even for ants.

buildup.text: Worker ants nap in extremely short bursts, ensuring the colony never stops functioning.

discovery.text: About 80 percent of the colony is awake at any given moment, providing continuous labor around the clock.

twist.text: Queens live up to 30 years while workers live one to three years. The sleep difference may explain the lifespan gap.

climax.text: Ant sleep shows that within a single species, sleep duration can vary dramatically based on social role.

punchline.text: In an ant colony, your job determines how much you sleep and how long you live.

quiz.question: How do fire ant queen and worker sleep patterns compare?
options: Queens sleep nine hours; workers take 250 one-minute naps totaling less than five hours
